Speaker: john
Dialogue: ...it had to be you...  ...be seein' ya'...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Do you need to go out?

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: I'm glad you didn't wanna' sell, old man.  I enjoyed this.

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: I gots my ways, yo! Now, it's hot as shit, so I wanna paint job, papers, fuckin-

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: I said, where... did you get that?

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: What the fuck are you sayin'?

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: What the fuck are you talking about?

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: I'm talkin' about you takin' this fuckin' car and gettin' the fuck outta' my shop.

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: Did you lose your shit, Aurelio? We own you. You do what we say.

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: The fuck you do. Tell me...

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: No.  But I sure as hell fucked up his dog.

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: You pull a gun? On me?   In my house?

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: The old man ain't gonna' like this.

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: I have, but it's not here.

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: If I turn down the work, the Russians turn to Takeshi and his crew. You'll find them down on Third and Main.

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: I know, John. I know... but "they"...  ..."they" are extremely dangerous people.

Speaker: mechanic #1
Dialogue: I DON'T KNOW WHO THE FUCK HE IS! HE JUST SHOWED UP AND STARTED SHOOTING!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Where can I find Iosef Tarasov?

Speaker: aurelio
Dialogue: Because he stole John Wick's car.

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: So I stole a fucking car!   So fucking what?

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Use that tone with me again...

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: It wasn't the "what you did", Iosef, which draws my ire, but "who you did it to".

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Careful, son... that old man happens to be three years younger than I.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: It got to him, though. Hell... How could it not? Even though he won every military distinction on record, including the Medal of HONOR-

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Then one day, he fell in love and left the game. The years scrolled past, age set in, and he -like myself- had to watch the love of his life die. Suddenly alone, with no family to speak of, John deserved to live -and die- in peace.  Instead...

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Until I say otherwise, you are under house arrest. Am I understood?

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm thinkin' he's the one.

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: Protocol's protocol. Stay put. I'll make this quick.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No...just sorting out a few things with the Russian mob.

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: Ah. Well, then... sort that out however you see fit. I'll cover your ass on my side of the fence as best I can.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Thanks, Ed... but you still owe me.

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: That, I do.  Good night, John.

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: Earlier today, there was an incident involving a `69 Mustang-

Speaker: edwardo
Dialogue: Oh. Well, then... I'd recommend you find yourself a new ride for the time being. The heat on that make ain't gonna' die down for quite some time.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This is Wick. John Wick, that's right. Yeah, it has been awhile.  I'd like to make a reservation for four.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I was sorry to hear about Norma.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: She was always kind to me.  So, what have you been doing to pass the time?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I got me a hobby or two.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I can see that.  Tell me, John... are we back in the game, now?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Sorry, Charlie, but no.     I'm on my own nowadays.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: That is a pity. I find the new breed of your ilk unstable, ill- wrought, and tiresome. The overused adage holds true: they don't make `em like they used to, John.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: My pleasure, John... and might I be expecting more such visitations?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I make no promises on that.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Good, good.  I've a favor to ask. One that pays quite well.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: As I keep telling those -like you- who keep calling, Viggo... I'm retired.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Hello, sir. How may I help you today?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I called ahead.     Reservation for John Wick.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Ah, yes.   I have you for two nights.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Depending on business, it may be more.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: That's not a problem, sir. We're only at sixty percent capacity.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Y'know, I haven't been here in years. When did the old girl get a facelift?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: She is. Daily, in fact.   Round about midnight.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Floor seven, room nine.  Would you like help with your bags?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Will there be anything else then, sir?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Can you send me up a hamburger - rare, mustard, onions, pickle- and fries?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: A nice Pinot. Mid-range. I'll leave that to your discretion.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I have one in mind. It'll be up in a half-hour.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: What would you like to drink?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Single Malt. Irish, if you've got it.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I've got a ten-year Michael Collins.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Perfect. Do you have a meat and cheese plate?

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: Another bottle of the Goose, love!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: My name is John Wick. You took my car. You killed my dog. Where... is Iosef?

Speaker: viktor
Dialogue: He moves about... from one place to the next... he's put Iosef under his thumb... wherever Viggo goes, so does Iosef.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: As for the car, I got that back, but as for Moose, well... I'm takin' a page from Exodus on that one: an eye for an eye.  No... no, better yet, Genesis.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Make your peace with God, Iosef...  ...for the Devil shall see you soon.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: The best, sir, however, I'm sorry to say that...  ...no one's that good.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No, I thought not.  Send me up a beer, too, will you?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Yes, sir.    What do you favor?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Lucky for you, no.   It looks to be a sub-sonic.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What sort of movement am I lookin' at?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: If you're lookin' to heal right quick, then keep it marginal. However, if you've still...  ...got a bit a' business to attend to...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: It'll hurt like hell, son... but come the long run, you'll be fine.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: It's what I do.  Evenin', John.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Maybe not... but I know this place.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Same goes for me, Mr. Wick.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: That, it has.  I'm glad to see the old place still up and runnin'.

Speaker: winston
Dialogue: I could say the same for you.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: John, my God, it's been... what?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm no good with time, but... it's been awhile.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: That, it has.  We we're all broken up over Norma, y'know.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: She got the card, the flowers... she knows you -all of you- loved her.  And thanks, Jimmy. It meant a lot to me as well.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Well, shit, it's good to see you, John. What can I get you?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Go on and take a seat.    I'll be with you in a moment.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: All good, John... and seriously... it's good to see you.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: John Wick in the flesh... my, oh, my... will wonders never cease.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I'm not quite sure, but with that said... here I am.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Here you are, indeed.   My, oh, my...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: And I haven't... I mean, not since the last time...  You can say, "no".

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No, no, Jenny... go right ahead. In fact... please do. I'd like to hear it, too.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Well, then... you be safe, you hear?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It's been awhile, but... here's to the past... may it influence our future.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Do you know where Iosef is?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Do you know where Viggo is?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Do you know anythin' worth knowin'?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Wait, wait!  Little Russia. There's a small bank near Cannon Court...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Viggo owns it. It's where he keeps his money. Every dollar of business he does clears through that building.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You keen on earnin' a coin?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Times bein' as they are? Yeah, John... I am.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Do you mind babysittin' the breathin' one for, I dunno...  ...the next six hours or so?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Good evening, Mr. Wick. I'm sorry to be calling you at this hour, but we've received a number of noise complaints from your floor.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You don't have to worry about that anymore. I'll be going to bed soon.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Have you any need of -say- a dinner reservation, perhaps?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Perfect. Oh, and...  Excellent. I'll need a car, and... well... something a bit less trivial.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You willin' to put a bullet in my back, Marcus?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Why'd you take the job then?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Because if not for me, it would have been someone who'd have just now pulled the trigger and simply walked away, leaving you to gasp your last.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Besides, we're the last of our kind; an endangered species of a sort. And I find comfort in knowing that there's someone like me still out there.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What am I doing, Marcus? I mean... it is just a... was a... dog, but...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Maybe not, but for the rare   man of our ilk -those who survived   an arguably unsurvivable life-   the few things we find time to care   for... pass long before we do...

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Left the game, got married, settled down... I envy that.  Kids?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: We tried, but... wasn't in the cards.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: I fucked a bartender and -ta dah!- nine months later, I had me a piece a' shit tossed on the old doorstep, but... when it comes down to it...  He's still my son.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: Funny how one would both die and kill for something they do not love.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Imagine what one would do if they did.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: People don't change. Do they, John?  SHUT... THE FUCK... UP!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Americano, please.    And a bear claw.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Down the hall to the left.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: His stash. Personal Holdings.  Piggy "fucking" Bank.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Unless I complete the call, then... yes.

Speaker: viggo
Dialogue: For me to die like this...  ...would be unfortunate.

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: How the fuck long do I have to stay down here?

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Until we are at sea, and even then, your access up top will be limited.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Good. Follow me. And if you shoot me in the back, I'll be the one to fuckin' kill you.

Speaker: iosef
Dialogue: Well, come on, muthafucka!   LET'S DANCE! YOU AND ME!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Through and through... through and through...
